verses.verse: They wandered blind in the streets; (Jer. 2:34) They have defiled themselves with blood, (Num. 19:16) So that no one would touch their garments.
They cried out to them, “Go away, (Lev. 13:45, 46) unclean! Go away, go away, Do not touch us!” When they fled and wandered, Those among the nations said, “They shall no longer dwell here.”
The face of the LORD scattered them; He no longer regards them. (Lam. 5:12) The people do not respect the priests Nor show favor to the elders.
Still (2 Kin. 24:7) our eyes failed us, Watching vainly for our help; In our watching we watched For a nation that could not save us.
(2 Kin. 25:4) They tracked our steps So that we could not walk in our streets. (Ezek. 7:2, 3, 6; Amos 8:2) Our end was near; Our days were over, For our end had come.
Our pursuers were (Deut. 28:49) swifter Than the eagles of the heavens. They pursued us on the mountains And lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
The (Gen. 2:7) breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the LORD, (Jer. 52:9; Ezek. 12:13) Was caught in their pits, Of whom we said, “Under his shadow We shall live among the nations.”
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of (Ps. 83:3-6) Edom, You who dwell in the land of Uz! (Jer. 25:15; Obad. 10) The cup shall also pass over to you And you shall become drunk and make yourself naked.

((Is. 40:2; Jer. 33:7, 8)) The punishment of your iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; He will no longer send you into captivity. (Ps. 137:7) He will punish your iniquity, O daughter of Edom; He will uncover your sins!
A Prayer for Restoration Remember, (Ps. 89:50) O LORD, what has come upon us; Look, and behold (Ps. 79:4; Lam. 2:15) our reproach!
(Ps. 79:1) Our inheritance has been turned over to aliens, And our houses to foreigners.
We have become orphans and waifs, Our mothers are like (Ex. 22:24; Jer. 15:8; 18:21) widows.
We pay for the water we drink, And our wood comes at a price.
(Deut. 28:48; Jer. 28:14) They pursue at our heels; We labor and have no rest.
(Gen. 24:2) We have given our hand (Hos. 9:3; 12:1) to the Egyptians And the (Jer. 2:18; Hos. 5:13) Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
(Jer. 31:29) Our fathers sinned and are no more, But we bear their iniquities.
Servants rule over us; There is none to deliver us from their hand.
We get our bread at the risk of our lives, Because of the sword in the wilderness.
Our skin is hot as an oven, Because of the fever of famine.
They (Is. 13:16; Zech. 14:2) ravished the women in Zion, The maidens in the cities of Judah.
Princes were hung up by their hands, And elders were not respected.
Young men (Judg. 16:21) ground at the millstones; Boys staggered under loads of wood.
